definition: anew/from the start
surname Cong

from/through/via/to follow/to obey/to engage in (an activity)/never (in negative sentence)/(Taiwan pr. [zong4]) retainer/assistant/auxiliary/subordinate/related by common paternal grandfather or earlier ancestor
suffix for nouns
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
from start to finish/from head to tail/the whole (thing)
from head to foot

sentences.english: You don't need to start with Chapter 1 and read it cover to cover.
sentences.chinese: 您不必与第1章开始和读取它从头到尾。

sentences.english: She can recite the long poem from the beginning to the end.
sentences.chinese: 她能把那首长诗从头到尾地背下来。

sentences.english: To my amazement, he was able to recite the poem from memory.
sentences.chinese: 令我大为惊奇的是，他把这首诗从头到尾背了出来。

sentences.english: Animated by fresh hops , he started again .
sentences.chinese: 他在新希望的激励之下，又从头做起。

sentences.english: Likewise, Sussman reads his newsweekly cover-to-cover every week.
sentences.chinese: 苏斯曼同样是每周都从头到尾地阅读新闻周刊。

sentences.english: It is because you know nothing about it that I'll tell you from the beginning.
sentences.chinese: 因为你对此事一无所知，所以我将对你从头说起。

sentences.english: The fire puja went well effortlessly from beginning to the end.
sentences.chinese: 火供从头至尾很轻松的进行得很顺利。

sentences.english: I read the entire book on the flight back to Connecticut.
sentences.chinese: 在回康涅狄格的飞机上，我从头到尾看完了这本书。

sentences.english: Start at the beginning and play the piece again.
sentences.chinese: 从头开始，这段再弹一遍。

sentences.english: To learn a language from the ground up, you have to be committed and resilient.
sentences.chinese: 从头开始学习一门语言，你必须坚定且有活力。

sentences.english: To start from scratch on everything goes so long as the narrowest opportunity exists.
sentences.chinese: 只要一息尚存，一切可以从头开始。

sentences.english: The whole pattern from the beginning.
My weariness amazes me, I'm branded on my feet.
sentences.chinese: 从头到脚的疲乏让我吃惊。

sentences.english: Be honest with yourself, every time a thought intrudes start counting from the beginning again.
sentences.chinese: 不要欺骗自己，每次一个念头侵入时就从头开始计数。

sentences.english: The FA also noted that at no time did Wenger mention Foy by name.
sentences.chinese: 足总同时指出从头到尾，温格都没提过福伊的名字。

sentences.english: If we have to start from scratch then it all takes time.
sentences.chinese: 如果我们要从头开始，那么这一切需要时间。

definition: from start to finish/from head to tail/the whole (thing)
tail/remainder/remnant/extremity/sixth of the 28 constellations/classifier for fish
horse's tail/pointed posterior section of a locust etc
one time (all the way through)/once through
from the inside to the outside/through and through/thoroughly
straight/to straighten/fair and reasonable/frank/straightforward/(indicates continuing motion or action)/vertical/vertical downward stroke in Chinese characters
surname Zhi/Zhi (c. 2000 BC), fifth of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
to the end (of)/at the end of/in the end/to come to an end
to catch and hold on/to continue/to go on to do sth/to follow/to carry on/then/after that/subsequently/to proceed/to ensue/in turn/in one's turn
everywhere/all over/classifier for actions: one time
variant of 遍[bian4]
to do something at one go/to flow smoothly
where there's a start, there's a finish (idiom); to finish once one starts sth/to carry things through/I started, so I'll finish.
over and over
the boring part of something (film, show, etc.) where a bathroom break can be taken
to penetrate/to pass through/thoroughly/completely/transparent/to appear/to show
again/once more/re-/second/another/then (after sth, and not until then)/no matter how ... (followed by an adjective or verb, and then (usually) 也[ye3] or 都[dou1] for emphasis)
early/prior/former/in advance/first
ending/coda/to wind up
